sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews now. I'm Takumbo Sulako with your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Many are called, but few are chosen. EU leaders are expected to confirm Ukraine and Moldova's bid to become EU candidate members. We'll have the latest from the Brussels summit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We have to call for decriminalization. I mean, the legislation as it is, is putting women at risk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The lawyer of an American woman denied an abortion in Malta tells us why emergency legislation is needed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And Afghanistan's Taliban rulers appeal for international help as searchers dig by hand for victims of the earthquake that killed at least 1,000 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: After years of fatigue, the question of EU enlargement is back on the table.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And the focus of an EU summit this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And although joining the EU is cumbersome, Ukraine wants in, no matter how long it takes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We're doing all the best to make sure that after the war we are part of the European family.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Getting the candidacy status would be a huge boost in morale for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: EU leaders are set to grant Ukraine their wish and greenlight the Commission opinion to make the country of 44 million a candidate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But it may remain a mere morale boost with no timeline for talks set in stone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As beyond the images of war, Ukraine is still a country with major corruption problems, democracy issues and slow growth.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But for some EU enlargement watchers, this is long overdue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I think the European Commission should have offered a membership perspective much earlier because it is the most powerful instrument the EU has to inspire democratization. This week's summit is not just about Ukraine, Moldova too and Georgia who saw thousands take to the streets this week in favor of a European future. They also applied back in March.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Western Balkan countries will also be in town, some seeking EU membership for decades. Albania, North Macedonia and Montenegro have given the green light to Ukraine's bid hoping it might speed up their enlargement dreams but others have a caveat. Western Balkans will not be left behind to open doors for someone else regardless of the political situation. I think that would be a huge mistake. Serbia has been radically transforming its economy for years in order to be EU ready and watched Croatia join the European Union back in 2013, the last country to do so. But with some highly political sensitive issues, their future, like all other aspiring EU countries, remains nebulous. Maeve McMahon, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Overnight heavy rain has added to the hardship and misery of survivors from a powerful earthquake

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: in eastern Afghanistan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The 6.1 magnitude quake has flattened stone and mud brick homes, killing at least 1,000 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It was the country's deadliest in two decades and officials are anticipating the death toll will rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Around 2,000 to 2,500 houses have been fully destroyed and many people have been wounded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: All the houses are destroyed and now we need tents and all other necessary items.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Getting help to the area is not easy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The roads, which are rutted and difficult to travel in the best of circumstances, have been badly damaged.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: difficult to travel in the best of circumstances have been badly damaged. There is a search and rescue operation going on and there are some medical supplies that have been given.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Norwegian Refugee Council is assessing today the situation in Khost province and tomorrow we are joining other agencies to look at the situation in Patika.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Afghanistan is already in the midst of a humanitarian and economic crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In a rare move, the ruling Taliban quickly called on the international community for help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: More than 60% of Afghanistan's population of 38 million already relies on international aid to survive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A desperate American couple is trying to leave Malta for a potentially life-saving abortion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Andrea Prudent and her partner have appealed to the country's authorities to allow them to leave after she started showing signs of miscarriage, including bleeding, while they were on vacation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The couple originally asked for the abortion due to the threat to the mother's life, but Valletta denied the procedure, saying it's not allowed under any circumstance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Let's hear more about this case now from Lara Dimitrievic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: She's a lawyer and women's rights activist in Malta.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: She's representing Andrea Prudente and her partner in their fight to terminate her pregnancy. Well, thanks for taking time to speak to us here on the program. Doctors have made it clear that her life is in grave danger. So tell us what's stopping them from saving her life. Well, I mean, Malta, we have a

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: total ban on abortion. So there are no provisions for emergency situations such as the situation of the mother's life being in danger. So under any circumstances and under all circumstances, abortion cannot take place. is waiting basically to have for her body basically to reject the pregnancy in a natural process whilst trying to keep her stable which obviously is prolonging the situation and also exposing her to a situation where she might develop sepsis and putting her at very grave risk. So yeah this is basically what the situation is currently. We've had this total ban on abortion since we've had our law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This is not the first case that we have come across, although, you know, not very common, but it is a medical situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And, you know, for the ones...

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I mean, in the case of Andrea, she's just waiting now for medical evacuation to take her to another hospital in Mallorca to have the termination done.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: You mentioned there are other cases and the interest in this case has generated more women coming forward explaining their cases that we're receiving those reports on social media. So what legal avenues are open to you now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Well I mean the situation is we have to call for decriminalization. I mean, the legislation as it is, is putting women at risk, whether it's in a medical situation that Andrea and women would be in, but also other women that for whatever reason might potentially not be able to carry a pregnancy or just simply wanting to terminate the pregnancy for their own reasons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So that's what it is, you know, it's a total ban and women are now looking for clandestine situations. So we have women that are leaving, you know, Malta and trying to find access to abortion care elsewhere. Malta remains only the only EU country where there is a total ban or purchasing the medication online. So purchasing the tablets online and then obviously doing it in a clandestine and illegal manner which is exposing them to criminal liability. Indeed it's good that you put in that reminder that Malta is the only country in the EU with this strict total ban on abortion do you think cases like this and then the interest that it's generating are going to help perhaps overturn this law. Well one would hope so. I mean we have been calling as women's activists. We have been calling for you know for the state to direct to decriminalize and legalize abortion because this has become untenable. I mean we are in the 21st century. We are in 2020. Moldau is at the forefront on many equality laws. We have just recently introduced the recognition of femicide in our law which is makes it only the second country within the European Union that has done that. So we still can't keep on calling that. Listen as a state we need to now start treating women with respect. I mean there are state obligations and women are not second class citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Lara Dimitrievich, a lawyer there and women's rights activist, joining us from Malta.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Thanks very much for your time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Thank you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Europe must be prepared for Moscow to turn off the gas taps by the end of this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: That's according to the head of the International Energy Agency, who called on the West to reduce its demand for gas and instead turn to nuclear energy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Fatih Birol also warned that the EU's efforts to preserve gas stocks do not go far enough.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russian energy giant Gazprom has cut its supply in recent weeks, but according to Birol this is just the beginning. Countries dependent on Russian fossil fuels are now under pressure to refill their storage tanks in a race against the clock.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The EU is now turning to other international suppliers, including the US, to buttress supplies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We're going to take a brief break on the programme right now, but if you want to get more on our top stories, do visit our website, euronews.com.
